headline: Frisee Salad with Lardons and Poached Eggs
description: This Frisee Salad with Lardons and Poached Eggs makes for a delicious brunch recipe.

video.description: Martha's recipe for this Frisee Salad with Lardons and Poached Eggs is inspired by one from Pastis restaurant in New York City. She shows us how to assemble the versatile salad using tender bite-size pieces of frisee, bacon, shallots, and a warm vinaigrette. It makes for a delicious breakfast or brunch recipe.
video.name: How to Make Martha Stewart's Frisee Salad with Lardons and Poached Eggs

name: Frisee Salad with Lardons and Poached Eggs
keywords: Bacon, Dinner, French, Frisee, Lunch, Poached eggs, Salads, Frisee Salad with Lardons and Poached Eggs
recipeIngredient: 4 heads frisee, inner white part only, washed well and spun dry, torn into bite-size pieces
8 ounces slab or thick-cut bacon, cut into Â¼-by-1-inch pieces
Coarse salt and freshly ground pepper

recipeInstructions.text: Fill a large, deep skillet 2/3 full with water, and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and add white vinegar. Place frisee in a large bowl; set aside.

Cook bacon, stirring occasionally, in a medium skillet over medium-high heat until golden brown, about 6 minutes. Remove bacon, reserving fat, and set aside. Add shallot to pan; cook until translucent, about 2 minutes. Add vinegar; bring to a boil, swirling to combine. Season with salt and pepper and remove from heat. Add bacon.

Break an egg into a small bowl; holding bowl just over simmering vinegar water, gently slide egg into water. Repeat with remaining eggs. Poach 1 to 2 minutes (longer for firm yolks). Transfer to a paper-towel-lined plate.

Return vinaigrette to stove to rewarm if necessary. Pour over frisee and toss gently to combine. Divide evenly among 4 serving plates. Use a slotted spoon to remove poached eggs, and place on the slice of white bread to drain. Top each salad with one egg. Season eggs with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

item.name: Frisee Salad with Lardons and Poached Eggs
